result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Davidson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 4/23/16 requesting application for alcohol treatment court.

Copy of letter provided to Attorney Kershek 4/25/16.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 2 of the amended information. Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

HUBER:  150 days consecutive,  Released for work, treatment and home day care for his father (Credit - 36 days).  

FINE: $1544.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF0003)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF0003)

D/L REVOCATION: 30 months consecutive;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 30 months;

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State needs a short adjournment to file amended information. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kershek advised court that Milwaukee County picked up the defendant yesterday for court, therefore, defense requests new date and stated it may be a possible plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order for After Hours Visiting filed by Attorney Kershek
Bail/bond hearing on April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests to address bail.  State is not prepared to address bail at this time. Court will set a short adjournment for the bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to see if his client is eligible for the Drug treatment court. Court grants adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 03-16-2016 09:30 am

Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to complete his case in Walworth County and to see if he can het in Drug Treatment Court here. Court grants. Hearing at 02-29-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant David J Davidson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin  Defense counsel is requesting a bail motion modification and presents arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion and bail remains as fixed. Defendant will be filling out the application for Drug Treatment Court, defense asks for a couple week adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing at 01-29-2016 10:00 am

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.   Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant and comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
